com.cyc.query.client

Class QueryImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.query.client.QueryImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.cyc.query.ModifiableQuerySpecification<com.cyc.query.Query>, com.cyc.query.Query, com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification<com.cyc.query.Query>, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class QueryImpl
extends Object
implements com.cyc.query.Query, Closeable
    QueryImpl is designed to represent queries posed to Cyc and provide access to their results.

    In general, the process of getting an answer from Cyc is:

    1. Create a QueryImpl object and set relevant fields on it.
    2. Access the answers via methods like #getAnswersCyc(), getResultSet(), or by adding a listener via addListener(com.cyc.query.QueryListener) and starting the query via performInference().
    3. To avoid filling up memory on the Cyc server, close() the QueryImpl when you are done with it, which will free up any lingering associated inference resources on the Cyc image. Queries are also closed when their finalize() method is invoked, notably when they are garbage collected.
    Author:
    Vijay Raj, David Baxter

        public static final long DEFAULT_QUERY_WORKER_TIMEOUT_MILLIS
        Do not use this value directly; instead, call getQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis(). It is currently set to 3 minutes.

      • QueryImpl

        public QueryImpl(String queryStr)
          throws com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException
        constructs a Query working with the string queryStr.

        The query is executed in InferencePSC with a default timeout and default inference parameters.

        Parameters:
        queryStr - the string representing the CycL query
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException
        See Also:
        com.cyc.query.Query#TIMEOUT

      • QueryImpl

        public QueryImpl(String queryStr,
                 String ctxStr)
          throws com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException
        Returns a query object defined by queryStr asked in Microtheory ctxStr, with default inference parameters.
        Parameters:
        queryStr - The query string.
        ctxStr - The Microtheory where the query is asked.
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException

      • QueryImpl

        public QueryImpl(String queryStr,
                 String ctxStr,
                 String queryParams)
          throws com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException
        Returns a query object defined by queryStr asked in Microtheory ctxStr, with inference parameters, queryParams.
        Parameters:
        queryStr - The query string.
        ctxStr - The Microtheory where the query is asked.
        queryParams - The inference parameters to use for the query. This string should consist of a series of keywords followed by the values for those keywords. The keywords can be found by looking for the #$sublIdentifier for the desired instance of InferenceParameter in the Cyc KB. For example, to limit a query to single-depth transformation and to allow at most 5 seconds per query, use the string ":max-transformation-depth 1 :max-time 5".
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static com.cyc.query.Query load(com.cyc.kb.KbIndividual id)
                                throws com.cyc.session.exception.UnsupportedCycOperationException,
                                       com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException,
                                       com.cyc.kb.exception.KbException
        Returns a QueryImpl object defined by a query term (i.e. an instance of #$CycLQuerySpecification). Use of this method is equivalent to calling Query#Query(com.cyc.kb.KBIndividual).
        Parameters:
        id - an instance of #$CycLQuerySpecification
        Returns:
        a QueryImpl object defined by queryTerm
        Throws:
        com.cyc.kb.exception.KbException - if there is a problem creating the QueryImpl object
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException - if there is some other kind of problem

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

        com.cyc.session.exception.UnsupportedCycOperationException

      • load

        public static QueryImpl load(com.cyc.kb.KbIndividual id,
                             Map<com.cyc.kb.KbObject,Object> indexicals)
        Returns a new QueryImpl loaded from a term in Cyc specifying its properties. Terms in the specified query can be replaced with others by providing a non-empty indexicals map.
        Parameters:
        id - the Cyc term
        indexicals - A map of substitutions to be made.
        Returns:
        the QueryImpl specified by id
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryRuntimeException -

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

      • load

        public static QueryImpl load(String idStr,
                             Map<String,String> indexicals)
                      throws com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException,
                             com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException,
                             com.cyc.session.exception.UnsupportedCycOperationException
        Returns a QueryImpl object defined by a CycLQuerySpecification term, and substitutes in relevant values from the indexicals Map.
        Parameters:
        idStr - The instance of CycLQuerySpecification
        indexicals - A map from terms in the query (as loaded from the KB) to the actual values that should be queried with.
        Returns:
        a QueryImpl object defined by idStr
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException -

        Note: QueryConstructionException is thrown if the specified query term has a sentence whose outermost operator is #$ist and the query is loaded from a Cyc server with a system level under 10.154917 (Nov. 2014). A workaround is to edit the query in the KB, removing the #$ist from the query's sentence, and specifying it as the query mt using #$microtheoryParameterValueInSpecification.

        com.cyc.kb.exception.KbTypeException - if idStr does not identify a KBIndividual.
        com.cyc.session.exception.UnsupportedCycOperationException

      • registerRequiredSksModules

        public void registerRequiredSksModules()
        Ensure that any required Semantic Knowledge Source removal modules for this query have been registered on the Cyc Server and made available for inference.

        This should be done prior to running a query or set of queries that relies on real-time access to external knowledge sources.

        Required knowledge sources are noted in the KB using the predicate sksiModulesNeeded.

        Specified by:
        registerRequiredSksModules in interface com.cyc.query.Query

      • continueQuery

        public void continueQuery()
        Continues the query. Can be used if a query has not been started yet, has stopped due to reaching the specified number of answers, or has used its alloted time or other resources and is continuable.

        Any resource constraints, e.g. time or number, get to "start over," so if the inference has already used its alloted 5 seconds, or found the specified three answers, continuing it will allow it to run for up to another 5 seconds, or until it finds up to another three answers.

        Returns when the inference has stopped running.

        Specified by:
        continueQuery in interface com.cyc.query.Query
        See Also:
        setMaxAnswerCount(Integer), setMaxTime(Integer), isContinuable(), #setContinuable(boolean), InferenceWorker#continueInference(com.cyc.base.inference.InferenceParameters)

      • findRedundantClauses

        public Collection<Collection<com.cyc.kb.Sentence>> findRedundantClauses()
                                                                 throws com.cyc.kb.exception.KbException,
                                                                        com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException,
                                                                        com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Identifies redundant clauses in this query. For instance, if one clause isa (isa ?X Dog) and another is (isa ?X GreatDane), that pair is considered redundant. This method provides no guidance as to what can or should be done to resolve the redundancy, and in fact it may be virtually harmless, as Cyc can often solve such a query almost as efficiently as it can solve the more specific clause of the pair.
        Specified by:
        findRedundantClauses in interface com.cyc.query.Query
        Returns:
        a collection of pairs of any such clauses
        Throws:
        com.cyc.kb.exception.KbException
        com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException - if there is a problem communicating with Cyc
        com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server

      • findUnconnectedClauses

        public Collection<com.cyc.kb.ArgPosition> findUnconnectedClauses()
                                                          throws com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException,
                                                                 com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Identifies unconnected clauses in this query. Generally, all clauses of a query will be connected by a chain of variables that connect them together. Queries with unconnected clauses are effectively separate queries, and running queries with disconnected clauses generally results in a cartesian product of the answer sets of the two separate queries.
        Specified by:
        findUnconnectedClauses in interface com.cyc.query.Query
        Returns:
        a collection of the arg positions of any such clauses
        Throws:
        com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException - if there is a problem communicating with Cyc.
        com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server

      • merge

        public com.cyc.query.Query merge(com.cyc.query.Query otherQuery)
                          throws com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException,
                                 com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException,
                                 com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException
        Conjoin this sentence with otherQuery, attempting to unify and rename variables. Typically, two different variables will unify into a single variable, causing all the uses of one of the variables to be renamed with the name of the other. In some cases, additional renaming may happen (e.g. if the queries contain mnemonic variables that become more tightly constrained as a result of the unification, a new mnemonic variable may be used in place of both of the original variables).
        Specified by:
        merge in interface com.cyc.query.Query
        Parameters:
        otherQuery -
        Returns:
        the new query
        Throws:
        com.cyc.query.exception.QueryConstructionException - if there was a problem constructing the new query.
        com.cyc.session.exception.SessionCommunicationException
        com.cyc.session.exception.OpenCycUnsupportedFeatureException - when run against an OpenCyc server

      • setMaxAnswerCount

        public QueryImpl setMaxAnswerCount(Integer max)
        Set the maximum number of answers (or sets of answers) that Cyc will attempt to find for this QueryImpl. In some cases (such as when a set of answers is retrieved in a batch), more answers than this may actually be returned. Once this number of answers has been reached, Cyc will not actively look for additional answers.
        Specified by:
        setMaxAnswerCount in interface com.cyc.query.ModifiableQuerySpecification<com.cyc.query.Query>
        Parameters:
        max -
        Returns:
        this QueryImpl
        See Also:

      • setQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause

        public QueryImpl setQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause(com.cyc.kb.Sentence sentence)
        Sets the hypothesized clause of this QueryImpl. When the query is run, Cyc will assume that this clause is true. If the clause is independently known to be false in the query context, the query will be considered tautologous, and will fail.
        Specified by:

        this QueryImpl.

      • clearResults

        public QueryImpl clearResults()
        Forget all results for this query. All settings on the QueryImpl are retained, including the query sentence, context, and inference parameters. After a QueryImpl has been cleared, it can be re-run, with possibly different results.
        Specified by:

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this query's result set, and releases resources on the Cyc server. See com.cyc.query.KBInferenceResultSet#close() for more details on what happens when a query is closed.

        It is good practice to always invoke this method explicitly as soon as a QueryImpl is no longer needed, as they can take up significant amounts of memory on the Cyc server.

        Specified by:
        close in interface com.cyc.query.Query
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        See Also:
        com.cyc.query.KBInferenceResultSet#close()

      • getDefaultQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis

        public long getDefaultQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis()
        Do not use this value directly; instead, call getQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis().
        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds that a QueryWorker will wait before throwing an exception if no soft timeout is specified in the query's inference parameters.

      • setDefaultQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis

        public void setDefaultQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis(long queryWorkerTimeoutMillis)

      • getQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis

        public long getQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis()
        Returns the number of milliseconds that a QueryWorker will wait, once started, before throwing an exception. A value of 0 milliseconds means to wait forever.

        If a soft timeout is specified in the inference parameters, the QueryWorker's hard timeout will be twice that duration to allow for additional overhead on top of the time required for the actual inference. If no soft timeout is specified in the inference parameters, this method will return the value of getDefaultQueryWorkerTimeoutMillis().

        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds that a QueryWorker will wait before throwing an exception.
